contents.title: YAFLA - Yet Anothe Factorio Library Attempt

children.value: This library is still in development, if you find any bugs please report them on the
This function take in input a table and tells you if the table is empty or not!
it you have a table that work as a

props.code:
function extended_table.is_empty(tbl)
    if #tbl > 0 then
        return false
    end

    for _, _ in pairs(tbl) do
        return false
    end

    return true
  end

children.value: This function take in input a table and a value and tells you if the element is present in the table!
This just avoid you to write the for loop each time...

props.code:
function extended_table.is_present(tbl, element)
  for _, v in pairs(tbl) do
      if v == element then
          return true
      end
  end
  return false
end

children.value: This function take in input a table, first element of the slice, last element of the slice, step of the slice.
This just avoid you to write the for loop each time...

props.code:
function extended_table.slice(tbl, first, last, step)
  local sliced = {}

  for i = first or 1, last or #tbl, step or 1 do
      sliced[#sliced+1] = tbl[i]
  end

  return sliced
end

children.value: check if the input parameters are correct, so if you insert value that does not match yout table it will crash.

An action is simply a function that is called "without" a specific event.
Actions can be delayed to be executed after x tick or loopep each x tick.
This function takes in input a number (the delay), a function, the data to be passed to the function or nothing.

props.code:
local function test()
  print("Executed")
end

actions.delay_action(10, test) -> wait 10 tick -> "Executed"

children.value:
This function takes in input a number (the interval), a function, the last tick to be executed or nothing, the data to be passed to the function or nothing.
It return the action id.
For now without a proper action_id ther's no way to get back or stop a loop action

props.code:
local function test()
  print("Executed")
end

actions.loop_action(10, test) -> wait 10 tick -> "Executed" -> wait 10 tick ...

children.value: If you want to pass parameters to the function but do not want the function to stop due to

props.code:
function actions.loop_action(interval, action, last_execution_tick, custom_data)
  local action_id = tostring(game.tick).."_"..tostring(#Actions_to_be_looped)

  Actions_to_be_looped[action_id] = {
      next_execution = game.tick + interval,
      last_execution_tick = last_execution_tick or -1,
      interval = interval,
      action = action,
      data = custom_data,
  }
  return action_id
end

children.value: This function takes in input a string, the action id of a loop_action and gives back the data of the loop_action.
For now without a proper action_id there's no way to get back or stop a loop action

props.code:
local action = actions.get_loop_action("10_1")
action = {
  next_execution = number,
  last_execution_tick = number,
  interval = number,
  action = function,
  data = any,
}

function actions.get_loop_action(action_id)
  if Actions_to_be_looped[action_id] then
      return Actions_to_be_looped[action_id]
  end
  return nil
end

children.value: This function takes in input a string, the action id of a loop_action and stops it without running the action.
For now without a proper action_id there's no way to get back or stop a loop action

props.code:
function actions.stop_loop_action(action_id)
  if Actions_to_be_looped[action_id] then
      Actions_to_be_looped[action_id] = nil
  end
end
